md_cooking_foods_desc_1:
Whether this is the kind of vegetable
stalk that Farfetch’d like is unknown.
md_cooking_foods_desc_2:
A juicy mushroom with an abundance
of umami flavor.
md_cooking_foods_desc_3:
A nutritious cooking ingredient that
goes well with all sorts of seasonings.
md_cooking_foods_desc_4:
Its mellow flavor makes both body
and spirit feel warm and fuzzy.
md_cooking_foods_desc_5:
An apple chosen above others. It has
spectacular form and a brilliant sheen.
md_cooking_foods_desc_6:
The fiery taste of this bright red
herb will wake anyone right up.
md_cooking_foods_desc_7:
A healthy sausage made from beans
that Pokémon like to eat.
md_cooking_foods_desc_8:
Highly nutritious milk. Pokémon that
drink it become full of energy.
md_cooking_foods_desc_9: A sweet honey collected by Pokémon.
md_cooking_foods_desc_10:
All-purpose oil that can be used in any
type of cuisine.
md_cooking_foods_desc_11:
Spicy ginger that warms the body
better than any other ingredient.
md_cooking_foods_desc_12:
A bright-red tomato. Eat it and you’ll
sleep like a baby.
md_cooking_foods_desc_13:
This cacao bean is time-consuming
to process, but its soothing effects
make the effort worthwhile.
md_cooking_foods_desc_14:
A very tasty tail of something. When
it falls off, it grows back quickly.
md_cooking_foods_desc_16:
This Greengrass Isle specialty can be
eaten raw. It’s remarkably sweet.
md_cooking_foods_desc_15:
This Greengrass Isle specialty is easy
to process into foods that are great
for training.
md_cooking_foods_desc_17_v220:
You may have trouble sleeping if you
indulge in too much of this. It may
help make you feel more alert.
md_cooking_foods_desc_1001:
A simple curry that lets the natural
sweetness of its apples shine.
md_cooking_foods_desc_1002:
The tasty tail elevates the flavor of
the curry roux to the next level.
md_cooking_foods_desc_1003:
A curry made using tomatoes that
have turned bright red in the sun.
md_cooking_foods_desc_1004:
The ingredients in this curry all share
a connection to deep sleep.
md_cooking_foods_desc_1005:
The roasted leeks are fragrant and
sweet as fruit, perfectly balancing
the spicy roux.
md_cooking_foods_desc_1006:
A curry that puts you to sleep just as
surely as the move Spore.
md_cooking_foods_desc_1007:
A curry made with oodles of love. Its
ingredients are geared toward kids.
md_cooking_foods_desc_1008:
This voluminous curry is large enough
to astound even a Snorlax.
md_cooking_foods_desc_1009:
A thick chowder made from potatoes
boiled until practically melting.
md_cooking_foods_desc_1010:
You can really taste the richness of
the milk in this simple chowder.
md_cooking_foods_desc_1011:
The tender bean patties are the star
of the show in this curry.
md_cooking_foods_desc_1012:
A mild curry containing plenty of
honey. Kids gobble it down!
md_cooking_foods_desc_1013:
This tofu curry is said to have been
a favorite dish of ninjas.
md_cooking_foods_desc_1014:
The freshly fried cutlet has a nice
sparkle to it.
md_cooking_foods_desc_1017:
The milk and corn in this creamy stew
have a mild, gentle sweetness.
md_cooking_foods_desc_1018:
This curry’s infernal spiciness kicks in
after the sweetness of the corn.
md_cooking_foods_desc_1015:
This curry is topped with a
masterfully cooked omelette
that simply melts in the mouth.
md_cooking_foods_desc_1016:
A hearty curry packed with nutrients
needed for bulking up.
md_cooking_foods_desc_1019:
A rhythmic one-two punch of sweet
and spicy flavors attacks your taste
buds, finishing with a hint of
bitterness.
md_cooking_foods_desc_1020:
A chunky tomato stew for a decadent
start to your day.
md_cooking_foods_desc_2001:
The mouth-tinglingly spicy pepper
highlights the sweetness of the tail.
md_cooking_foods_desc_2002:
A salad rich in minerals that improve
the quality of sleep.
md_cooking_foods_desc_2003:
A bacon salad topped with a generous
snowy sprinkling of cheese.
md_cooking_foods_desc_2018:
The refreshing sweetness of this
fruit salad soothes the soul.
md_cooking_foods_desc_2004:
This potato salad contains just a hint
of flavor from the Fancy Apples.
md_cooking_foods_desc_2005:
A salad topped with wobbly cubes
of tofu.
md_cooking_foods_desc_2006:
A hefty salad that provides all your
daily nutrients at once.
md_cooking_foods_desc_2007:
This simple salad features ham made
from Bean Sausages.
md_cooking_foods_desc_2008:
The Snoozy Tomatoes in this simple
salad are a great aid for sleep.
md_cooking_foods_desc_2009:
A basic salad containing only cheese,
tomatoes, and a splash of oil.
md_cooking_foods_desc_2019:
When eating this salad, you should
start by attacking the mound of corn.
md_cooking_foods_desc_2010:
The savory sauce and sweet chocolate
sauce let you enjoy a mix of flavors.
md_cooking_foods_desc_2011:
This salad’s special ginger dressing
warms you through and through.
md_cooking_foods_desc_2012:
A simple salad accentuated by a
mashed apple dressing.
md_cooking_foods_desc_2013:
The crisp leeks in this salad do
wonders for the immune system.
md_cooking_foods_desc_2014:
The simple seasoning keeps the focus
on the sublime pairing of ingredients.
md_cooking_foods_desc_2015:
Ninjas cannot resist the flavor of this
tofu salad. It’s eaten in a flash!
md_cooking_foods_desc_2016:
A tofu salad covered in bright red
spicy sauce.
md_cooking_foods_desc_2017:
A salad made of fresh vegetables—all
harvested on Greengrass Isle.
md_cooking_foods_desc_2020:
A chopped salad delicately made with
fine repeated cuts.
md_cooking_foods_desc_2021:
A chef worked defiantly to perfect
this salad with coffee dressing,
tweaking the recipe again and again.
md_cooking_foods_desc_3001:
These perfectly ripe potatoes don’t
rely on honey to deliver a sweet kick.
md_cooking_foods_desc_3002:
These cookies give you the power to
tackle hardships without crumbling.
md_cooking_foods_desc_3003:
A rich juice containing only the very
best apples.
md_cooking_foods_desc_3005:
Apples have been added to the spicy
ginger, helping the tea go down easily.
md_cooking_foods_desc_3006:
A very special flan that’s as springy
as a balloon.
md_cooking_foods_desc_3007:
A relaxing drink that soothes your
weariness and envelops you in sleep.
md_cooking_foods_desc_3008:
The chunky pieces of apple in this pie
are lucky finds!
md_cooking_foods_desc_3009:
A special restorative tea made by
Professor Neroli.
md_cooking_foods_desc_3010:
Neither people nor Pokémon can resist
the lure of this cake’s sweet aroma.
md_cooking_foods_desc_3011:
Moomoo Milk that has been heated
to further draw out its sweetness.
md_cooking_foods_desc_3012: A soy cake with a nice, light texture.
md_cooking_foods_desc_3013:
A glass of this sweet smoothie is a
treat after a training session.
md_cooking_foods_desc_3014:
An easy-to-make juice with natural
sweet-and-sour flavors.
md_cooking_foods_desc_3015:
A special fried bread made using a
recipe from the Alola region.
md_cooking_foods_desc_3016:
Soy donuts fried to crisp perfection.
They’re a bodybuilder’s best friend.
md_cooking_foods_desc_3017:
Prepared in an instant with enough
heat to cause an explosion.
md_cooking_foods_desc_3018:
This flaky scone is most delicious
when paired with an equal amount of
apple ginger jam.
md_cooking_foods_desc_3019:
A tricksy tart that scatters flower
petals when you eat it.
md_cooking_foods_desc_3020:
These macarons are perfect to give as
a gift—they always make the
recipient smile.
md_cooking_foods_desc_3021:
This slightly bitter coffee jelly can
help wake you up faster.
md_cooking_foods_desc_3022:
This cola’s strong bite will jolt
you awake!
md_cooking_foods_desc_3023:
This tiramisu recipe defies precedent
by relying on the sweetness of corn
alone.
md_cooking_foods_desc_3024:
A generously filled, bitter éclair with
a cheery Clodsire design.
